input_text:
Job Title: Thermal Analysis Engineer

Location: Houston, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Thermal Analysis Engineer - Space - Opportunity to Advance - Full Benefits

This Jobot Consulting Job is hosted by: Alexa Holz

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.

Salary: $40 - $60 per hour

A bit about us:

We are a company focused on space exploration

Why join us?

Medical

Dental

Vision

401K

Paid Holiday

Paid Vacation

Job Details

Job Details:

We are seeking a dynamic and innovative Thermal Analysis Engineer to join our forward-thinking team. The ideal candidate will be a seasoned professional with a minimum of 5 years of experience in thermal control systems and thermal analysis. You will be responsible for providing expert advice and solutions to our clients, helping them to optimize their systems and processes, and ensuring that they meet all relevant standards and regulations. This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced engineer who is looking to take on a challenging and rewarding role, where they will have the chance to make a real impact on our clients' operations.

Responsibilities:

 Conduct comprehensive thermal analysis on a variety of systems and components, using both analytical and experimental techniques. Provide expert consulting services to our clients, helping them to optimize their thermal control systems and processes. Develop and implement innovative solutions to complex thermal problems, ensuring that all solutions are efficient, effective, and compliant with all relevant standards and regulations. Collaborate closely with our clients' engineering teams, providing them with the support and guidance they need to successfully implement your recommendations. Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the field of thermal engineering, ensuring that our company and our clients are always at the cutting edge. Prepare detailed reports and presentations on your findings and recommendations, communicating complex technical information in a clear and understandable way.

Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field. A Master's degree or Ph.D. is preferred. Minimum of 5 years of experience in thermal control systems and thermal analysis. Strong knowledge of thermal control systems, including their design, implementation, and optimization. Experience in conducting both analytical and experimental thermal analysis. Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to develop and implement innovative solutions to complex problems. Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical information in a clear and understandable way. Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team. Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet tight deadlines. Proficiency in using thermal analysis software and tools. Familiarity with relevant standards and regulations in the field of thermal engineering.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Thermal Analysis Engineer
output_json.summary: Seeking a Thermal Analysis Engineer with 5+ years of experience in thermal control systems and thermal analysis.
